Table of Contents

NAME

QccMatrixSVD - singular value decomposition

SYNOPSIS

#include "libQccPack.h"

int QccMatrixSVD(const QccMatrix A, int num_rows, int num_cols, QccMatrix U, QccVector S, QccMatrix V);

DESCRIPTION

QccMatrixSVD() performs the singular value decomposition (SVD) of matrix A which has size num_rows x num_cols. The SVD is returned in the form of matrix U (size num_rows x num_cols), vector S (length num_cols), and matrix V (size num_cols x num_cols), such that A = U * diag(S) * V^T, where diag(S) is the num_cols x num_cols matrix with S on the diagonal.

Any of U, V, or S can be NULL, in which case the corresponding value is calculated but not returned.

IMPLEMENTATION

The QccPack implementation of SVD is essentially a call to gsl_linalg_SV_decomp(3) , part of the GNU Scientific Library (GSL). As a consequence, if GSL is not available, QccMatrixSVD() will not work. In the case that num_rows is less than num_cols, gsl_linalg_SV_decomp(3) cannot be employed directly. In this case, num_cols - num_rows rows of zeros are concatenated onto A before calling gsl_linalg_SV_decomp(3) , and the output quantities

SEE ALSO

gsl_linalg_SV_decomp(3) , QccMatrix(3) , QccPack(3)
